page.title: 04THE JOHN RADCLIFFE HOSPITAL.
page.content: The original{Radcliffe Infirmary}was built in{Oxford}on the death of {Dr John Radcliffe}in the{17th}century when he left a sum of money for this purpose.{Phase I (Maternity Dept)}of the new hospital opened in{1971,}and {Phase II (Main Hospital)}in{1979,}on {70}acres of land. There are{196}doctors at the{J.R,}and it specialises in{General Medicine,} cardiac surgery, haemotology, pathology, neonatal surgery, and paediatrics among others. Some of these{doctors}train{students}to become qualified. They train nurses as well, for accident and emergency nursing, I.T.U. treatments, anaesthetics, children's nursing and radiography. A nurse's shift is{7 and a half hours} long. There is a big training factor at the{J.R.}Yearly lectures are given to refresh people's memories.
